It's multiplicative. 50 stacks reduces it to 90%, 100 reduces it to 81%, then 73%, then 67%, 61%, and so on.

They should word it as "base cooldown by 10%", because it's one of very very few cases of non-additive CD in the game.
The effect has some sort of multiplier each time you hit the cap needed for another 10%. You need like 2,500 stacks to get 100%, in which case Veig is probably 1 shotting anyways.

I don't know about any of you, but I personally think this is EXACTLY what Veigar needs. 

Dark Matter has felt lackluster since the delayed Event Horizon from the rework. Now, what you can do is throw down Event Horizon and then drop a barrage of meteors all over the caged area to try and maximize your damage. Isn't that exactly what a final boss like Veigar would do? 

Combine that with the Sorcery keystone Meteor and Veigar is an incredibly dangerous, bursty champion even without his ultimate.

That's certainly an interesting way to look at it.

I mean, he can't just endlessly drop them; you need a TON of stacks for the 100% cooldown, but I don't mind him having it simply because it's such a tough shot to hit.
